dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 5140 IH: To lower the age at which a minor may be tried as an adult for certain criminal offenses in the District of Columbia to 14 years of age.

action.action-desc: Mr. Gill of Texas introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To lower the age at which a minor may be tried as an adult for certain criminal offenses in the District of Columbia to 14 years of age.

section.header: Lowering age at which a minor may be tried as adult for certain criminal offenses in District of Columbia

subsection.header: Lowering age at which minor may be excluded from jurisdiction of Family Court
subsection.text: Section 16–2301, District of Columbia Official Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking sixteen years of age and inserting fourteen years of age; and
in paragraph (3) in the matter following subparagraph (C), by striking the age of sixteen and inserting the age of fourteen.

subsection.header: Lowering age at which minor may be transferred to criminal proceeding
subsection.text: Section 16–2307(a), District of Columbia Official Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking fifteen and inserting fourteen;
in paragraph (2), by striking sixteen and inserting fourteen; and
in paragraph (3), by striking eighteen and inserting fourteen.

subsection.text: This Act, and the amendments made by this Act, shall apply with respect to criminal offenses committed on and after the date of the enactment of this Act.
